definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: The protesters are just reminding those in power to look down.
sentences.chinese: 示威者就是在提醒那些当权者往下看。

sentences.english: Cowardly Christianity never poses a threat to the powers and principalities of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 懦弱的基督徒从来不会对黑暗势力及当权者构成威胁。

sentences.english: There's a history of the underdog using standup comedy to speak truth to power.
sentences.chinese: 向来都有被压迫的人借滑稽说笑向当权者说出真相。

sentences.english: Making peace with the establishment is an important aspect of maturity.
sentences.chinese: 与当权派达成妥协是成熟的重要表现之一。

sentences.english: The Party seeks power entirely for its own sake.
sentences.chinese: 党要当权完全是为了它自己。

sentences.english: Companies need to cultivate cordial relations with local potentates, too.
sentences.chinese: 公司还需要巴结本地当权者。

sentences.english: He was waiting for the powers that is to decide what his next job would is.
sentences.chinese: 他在等待当权派给他分派下一工作。

sentences.english: It is his legal right to appeal .
Under the weight of these heavy manners, let the power fall.
sentences.chinese: 受够了那些沉甸甸的重压，打倒当权派。

sentences.english: Some said that Chinese rulers are really stupid, using money to buy troubles for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 有人说中国大陆的当权者真傻，用钱买气受。

sentences.english: The law defends people from injustice.
sentences.chinese: 法律保护人民的正当权益不受侵犯。

sentences.english: This part of the building is used by local authorities for meetings.
sentences.chinese: 建筑的这部分是给本地当权者开会使用的。

sentences.english: This was the context in which the left came to power.
sentences.chinese: 这便是左翼政党当权时的时代背景。

sentences.english: People in power must bear some responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 当权者必须肩负某些责任。

sentences.english: It is sometimes hard to explain to authorities why one would want to do such things.
sentences.chinese: 有时候不太容易向当权者解释为什么有人爱干这类事。

sentences.english: In power he unapologetically favoured his home region.
sentences.chinese: 他当权时，面无愧色地大加偏爱他的家乡。

definition: to wield (political etc) power/be in power
to come to power/to hold power/in office
to be in a position of power
to overthrow/downfall/to fall from power/to go bankrupt
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to win power/to get authority/to become dominant
